meanings.definition: A person who walks or behaves in a very confident and typically arrogant or aggressive way.
meanings.sent1: The swaggerers strutted down the street, exuding confidence.
meanings.sent2: The group of swaggerers made quite an entrance at the party.
meanings.sent3: The swaggerers thought they were the coolest kids in town.
meanings.sent4: Among the timid crowd, the swaggerers stood out like bold lions.
meanings.sent5: Their swaggerers was so pronounced that even strangers took notice.

meanings.definition: Those who boast or brag in a loud and showy manner.
meanings.sent1: The swaggerers at the bar were loud and obnoxious.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't stand the constant boasting of the swaggerers in her class.
meanings.sent3: The swaggerers' exaggerated stories always drew a crowd.
meanings.sent4: In a room full of modest individuals, the swaggerers were like peacocks showing off.
meanings.sent5: Their swaggerers was so over-the-top that it bordered on comical.
